steps.title: Skrunkly describes something that is cute in a messy or unconventional way.
steps.content: Skrunkly describes something that is cute in a messy or unconventional way. Skrunkly is both an adjective and a noun used to describe something that is kind of funky-looking but also attractive or cute, often because itâ€™s scruffy or disheveled. Skrunkly is a positive term of endearment thatâ€™s mainly used to describe animals, particularly strange-looking cats and dogs, but the internet has also adapted it to describe celebrities and fictional characters. [1] X Research source Examples: â€œMy cat fell in the bathtub and now he looks all skrunkly.â€ â€œMy favorite characters are always so skrunkly. Theyâ€™re just funky little guys.â€ â€œThat dog has really scruffy fur and crooked teeth. He's skrunkly.â€ Skrunkly is sometimes spelled as â€œscrunkly,â€ â€œscrungly,â€ or â€œskrungly.â€ These words all have the same meaning. While the exact etymology of the â€œskrunklyâ€ is unknown, it may be a blend of the words â€œscrunchedâ€ and â€œcrinkly.â€

steps.title: â€œSkrunklyâ€ comes from a meme that originated on Instagram in 2021.
steps.content: â€œSkrunklyâ€ comes from a meme that originated on Instagram in 2021. steps.title: Throughout 2021, the skrunkly meme gained popularity on other social media apps.
steps.content: Throughout 2021, the skrunkly meme gained popularity on other social media apps. On June 14, 2021, YouTuber Bakamatsu posted a voiceover video of the memeâ€™s caption with an image of a cat in place of the fox, which gained over 3,300 likes in two months. On the same day, Twitter (now X) user @dailyseafriends posted their own version of the meme, replacing the fox with an image of a sea creature. This skrunkly trend continued as social media users made their own versions of the meme. [3] X Research source As the meme gained popularity, many people started posting the caption with images of characters from various media. People then started using the word â€œskrunklyâ€ in daily life to describe different animals and characters.

steps.title: Scrimblo/Scrimblo Bimblo
steps.content: Scrimblo/Scrimblo Bimblo â€œScrimbloâ€ describes something or someone that is cute and lovable. It is derived from Scrimblo Bimblo, which is a made-up video game character from a tweet poking fun at Super Smash Bros fans who get upset when their favorite obscure characters arenâ€™t included in the games. Scrimblo Bimblo has come to describe a well-loved, yet underappreciated character or celebrity. [4] X Research source For example, â€œThat character is so scrimblo. Theyâ€™re absolutely adorable!â€

steps.title: Poor little meow meow
steps.content: Poor little meow meow A â€œpoor little meow meowâ€ is someone, often a fictional character, who is downtrodden, morally questionable/evil, and/or pathetic. The term was originally a nickname for Suga of BTS because the bandâ€™s fandom believed he looked like a cat. It quickly spread across social media and fandoms and became associated with sad, morally gray characters. [5] X Research source For example, â€œYes, my favorite character may be a murderer, but heâ€™s just my poor little meow meow.â€

steps.title: Blorbo
steps.content: Blorbo A â€œ blorbo â€ is your favorite character from a TV show, movie, or fandom. Popularized on Tumblr, this term is often used in the phrase â€œblorbo from my showsâ€ to talk about a character you find particularly endearing. [6] X Research source For example, â€œIâ€™m so worried about what will happen to my blorbo in season 3.â€

steps.title: Eeby deeby
steps.content: Eeby deeby â€œEeby deebyâ€ is a term for a made-up or unknown location. This phrase originated with an image of an elevator displaying the words â€œEeby deebyâ€ rather than the floor number it was going to. The meme became popular around the same time as words like â€œblorboâ€ and â€œscrimblo,â€ and theyâ€™re often associated with each other because theyâ€™re nonsense words. [7] X Research source For example, â€œMy blorbo fell off a cliff at the end of the last episode. She went straight to eeby deeby.â€
